PORTLAND - Hundreds of same-sex couples lined up at courthouses across Oregon Monday, to register as domestic partners.
 
 In its last session, the Oregon Legislature had legalized the civil unions - a legal recognition and obligation which carries many of the rights and responsibilities of marriage. 
 
 Gays and lesbians wasted no time taking advantage of the new law, some lining up at 4 a.m. outside the Multnomah County building. Although the legislature had made it legal, implementation was held up by a ballot petition which would have blocked the new law. After a court ruled [on Friday, Feb 1] that the ballot measure didn't have enough signatures, the doors were opened for the new Oregon civil unions.
 
 Ten other states, plus the District of Columbia, have similar laws.

post_info.post_title: Oregon Domestic Partner Law Goes Into Effect

Good news for those who live in Oregon, including my nephew.
